result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael John Ransom

defendant.name: Ransom, Michael John
defendant.address: W5056 Paradise Ln, Fond du Lac, WI 54937

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Absolute sobriety; Not possess/use any controlled substance without valid prescription

Defendant Michael John Ransom appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Amanda M. Belville appeared by video for Michael John Ransom.  Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def consents to appearing by video.  Counsel's first appearance.  DOC is pursuing ATR, but is unsure of date.  Court reinstates $5000 signature bond.  Court adj; def to appear in person unless counsel contacts clerk to advise of def's whereabouts.
Hearing scheduled for December 14, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Per contact w/State and counsel, HE set 10-27-22 at 9:45am rescheduled to 10-20-22 at 3:30pm to accommodate video appearance; arrangements made for def to appear by video from the Fond du Lac Co Jail for this hearing.  Notice sent.

Adjustment Number: 22A 175625,
Payable Number: 170930,
Receipt Number: 22R 019586,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Michael John Ransom not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  FDC Jail was on but disconnected;  Court reschedules to allow defendant to appear and warrant/bail forf shall remain in place at this time. 
Hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Arrangements made for def to appear by Zoom from the Fond du Lac Co Jail for hearing on 10-12-22.
Return on warrant on October 12, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Defendant Michael John Ransom not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court issues warrant and orders bail forfeiture.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. Not possess or use any controlled substance without valid prescription.

Defendant Michael John Ransom in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Edgar A Beltran in court for Michael John Ransom. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights. Def will be obtaining private counsel.  Court sets $5000 signature bond.  Def waives time limit on preliminary hearing, court accepts. Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney. Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:15 am.
